channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: RØDE Quietly Unveils Its New Premium USB Hub Designed Specifically For Content Creators
item.description: This new USB hub from RØDE is made from aluminum alloy and features six USB-C ports, one USB-A port and slots for SD and microSD cards as well as 60W ...

item.title: How Macy’s, Dillard’s, and Nordstrom are getting their groove back
item.description: Department stores have a new playbook to win back shoppers from discount stores and Amazon.

item.title: Rubin Observatory Finds Massive Stellar Stream Around Spiral Galaxy M61
item.description: First look images from the Rubin Observatory reveal a massive stellar stream around the Messier 61 grand spiral galaxy, located in the Virgo Cluster o...

item.title: Inside A Billionaire Couple’s Plan To Give Away Their $20 Billion Facebook Fortune
item.description: Former journalist and wife of Facebook cofounder Dustin Moskovitz, Cari Tuna steered millions into AI safety research ahead of ChatGPT's launch. Here’...

item.title: Even as stocks slide, Wall Street is at ‘historically extreme valuations,’ warns Apollo chief economist
item.description: The latest data underlines a broader concern among analysts that a reckoning is looming for the markets.

item.title: Gen Alpha won’t ever have to write an email when they join the workforce, new research reveals—they’ll be sending voice notes to their boss instead
item.description: LSE researchers say Gen Alpha will talk, not type at work—they predict that voice notes will make keyboard practically obsolete by 2030.

item.title: AI’s Chicken Or Egg Dilemma: What Comes First, Vision Or Data?
item.description: Artificial intelligence: where do we begin? Do we start with the data, or do we start by reinventing our processes?

item.title: Microsoft Confirms Windows Update Mistake—Do Not Get ‘Locked Out’
item.description: Act now after warnings that users are getting locked out of Windows PCs.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says ‘The Social Network’ nailed his wardrobe: ‘Every single shirt or fleece they had in that movie is a shirt or fleece that I own’
item.description: Zuckerberg even bought one of the shirts worn by actor Jesse Eisenberg, on auction, for over $4,000.

item.title: Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay package and the race to the bottom among states with weak corporate governance laws
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: FAA confirms which 40 markets will have airline traffic cut 10%
item.description: The FAA orders 10% flight reductions at 40 major U.S. airports starting Friday due to air traffic controller shortages during the government shutdown.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
